description: b. Ways to prevent infection and transmission
title: b. Ways to prevent infection and transmission
content:
•    Understand the nature of the disease, how it is transmitted, and how to
prevent it from spreading further.  
•    Listen to and follow directives issued by the Ministry of Health.  
•    If you suspect someone close to you or in your community of having Ebola
virus disease, encourage and support them in seeking appropriate medical
treatment in a health-care facility.  
•    Wash your hands with water and soap after visiting hospitals or caring
for any other patient.  
•    Develop the habit of washing your hands with clean water and soap
regularly, especially before eating or touching food.  
•    Avoid touching your mouth with dirty hands.  
•    Additionally, individuals should reduce contact with high-risk infected
animals (i.e. fruit bats, monkeys or apes) in the affected rainforest areas.
